citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Natranaerobiaceae (Natr.an.ae.ro.bi.aâ€²ce.ae. N.L. n. Natranaerobius type genus of the family; -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Natranaerobiaceae the family of the genus Natranaerobius).
Cells are Gram-staining and Gram-type-positive; endospores are not observed.
Straight or slightly curved, slender rods.
Phylogenetically, the family belongs to the order Natranaerobiales.
